revised_title: The Efficiency of Mass Loss in Breeding Birds: A Reevaluation
tldr: This study investigates the efficiency of mass loss in breeding birds and how it affects the energy delivered to their young. The author constructs simple time budget models to estimate the value of energy released by mass loss and finds that the transfer of energy has an efficiency typically less than one. The analysis also provides a new result about optimal flight speed.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
